metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7797 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Pacemaker before 1.1.15, when using pacemaker remote, might allow remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (node disconnection) via anunauthenticated connection.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7797` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcib3 - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.3
libcrmcluster4 - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.3
libcrmcommon3 - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.3
libcrmservice1 - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.3
liblrmd1 - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.3
libpe-rules2 - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.3
libpe-status4 - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.3
libpengine4 - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.3
libstonithd2 - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.3
libtransitioner2 - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.3
pacemaker - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.3
pacemaker-cli-utils - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.3
pacemaker-remote - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pacemaker package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.3').
